expertiseDomains.title: Corporate Governance
expertiseDomains.expertise: Marie-Noëlle Zen-Ruffinen is a recognized expert in corporate governance. She regularly advises public, private and family-owned companies in the review or the setting up of their governance. She advises on strategic and legal matters related to board structure and operations, compliance, shareholders' and key stakeholders' relations, executive compensation and remuneration policy. She regularly conducts personalized governance training sessions and assists boards of directors in their evaluation process as an external facilitator. Marie-Noëlle Zen-Ruffinen serves on the board of directors of several listed and privately held companies. She co-founded the Swiss Board Institute and is the author | co-author of numerous publications, including the reference book Le Conseil d'administration. She is also a member of various panels of experts and a frequent speaker on topics related to corporate governance.

expertiseDomains.title: Legacy, Succession planning, organization of family wealth transfers
expertiseDomains.expertise: Marie-Noëlle Zen-Ruffinen advises individuals and families on shaping a meaningful legacy and a vision for sustainable generational impact. She has extensive expertise in managing comprehensive successions' planning (both domestic and cross-border) and in handling all asset types (including real estate, financial holdings, art collections and family businesses). She acts as a trusted executor to ensure that the estate is transferred according to the deceased's wishes in a smooth and hassle-free manner for the heirs. She further advises on family governance frameworks to ensure clarity, operational efficiency and alignment of interests across generations.

Marie-Noëlle Zen-Ruffinen advises clients on property transactions and provides strategic and legal counsel on real estate structuring and contract negotiation. She has special expertise in Lex Koller regulations, assisting foreign investors in navigating restrictions on property acquisitions in Switzerland.

Marie-Noëlle Zen-Ruffinen advises on the negotiation and drafting of commercial contracts and she regularly provides legal opinions on early termination of commercial contracts (e.g., distribution, license). Her PhD thesis is considered a key reference on the subject.
